2094 static UniValue encryptwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2095 {
2096  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2097  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2098 
2099  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2100  return NullUniValue;
2101  }
2102 
2103  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 1) {
2104  throw std::runtime_error(
2105  RPCHelpMan{"encryptwallet",
2106  "\nEncrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption.\n"
2107  "After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing \n"
2108  "will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls.\n"
2109  "Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call.\n"
2110  "If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call.\n",
2111  {
2112  {"passphrase", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long."},
2113  },
2114  RPCResults{},
2115  RPCExamples{
2116  "\nEncrypt your wallet\n"
2117  + HelpExampleCli("encryptwallet", "\"my pass phrase\"") +
2118  "\nNow set the passphrase to use the wallet, such as for signing or sending bitcoin\n"
2119  + HelpExampleCli("walletpassphrase", "\"my pass phrase\"") +
2120  "\nNow we can do something like sign\n"
2121  + HelpExampleCli("signmessage", "\"address\" \"test message\"") +
2122  "\nNow lock the wallet again by removing the passphrase\n"
2123  + HelpExampleCli("walletlock", "") +
2124  "\nAs a JSON-RPC call\n"
2125  + HelpExampleRpc("encryptwallet", "\"my pass phrase\"")
2126  },
2127  }.ToString());
2128  }
2129 
2130  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
2131  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
2132 
2133  if (pwallet->IsCrypted()) {
2134  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_WRONG_ENC_STATE, "Error: running with an encrypted wallet, but encryptwallet was called.");
2135  }
2136 
2137  // TODO: get rid of this .c_str() by implementing SecureString::operator=(std::string)
2138  // Alternately, find a way to make request.params[0] mlock()'d to begin with.
2139  SecureString strWalletPass;
2140  strWalletPass.reserve(100);
2141  strWalletPass = request.params[0].get_str().c_str();
2142 
2143  if (strWalletPass.empty()) {
2144  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "passphrase can not be empty");
2145  }
2146 
2147  if (!pwallet->EncryptWallet(strWalletPass)) {
2148  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ENCRYPTION_FAILED, "Error: Failed to encrypt the wallet.");
2149  }
2150 
2151  return "wallet encrypted; The keypool has been flushed and a new HD seed was generated (if you are using HD). You need to make a new backup.";
2152 }
2153 
2154 static UniValue lockunspent(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2155 {
2156  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2157  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2158 
2159  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2160  return NullUniValue;
2161  }
2162 
2163  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 2)
2164  throw std::runtime_error(
2165  RPCHelpMan{"lockunspent",
2166  "\nUpdates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.\n"
2167  "Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.\n"
2168  "If no transaction outputs are specified when unlocking then all current locked transaction outputs are unlocked.\n"
2169  "A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending bitcoins.\n"
2170  "Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list\n"
2171  "is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.\n"
2172  "Also see the listunspent call\n",
2173  {
2174  {"unlock", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions"},
2175  {"transactions", RPCArg::Type::ARR, /* default */ "empty array", "A json array of objects. Each object the txid (string) vout (numeric).",
2176  {
2177  {"", RPCArg::Type::OBJ, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED, "",
2178  {
2179  {"txid", RPCArg::Type::STR_HEX, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The transaction id"},
2180  {"vout", RPCArg::Type::NUM, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The output number"},
2181  },
2182  },
2183  },
2184  },
2185  },
2186  RPCResult{
2187  "true|false (boolean) Whether the command was successful or not\n"
2188  },
2189  RPCExamples{
2190  "\nList the unspent transactions\n"
2191  + HelpExampleCli("listunspent", "") +
2192  "\nLock an unspent transaction\n"
2193  + HelpExampleCli("lockunspent", "false \"[{\\\"txid\\\":\\\"a08e6907dbbd3d809776dbfc5d82e371b764ed838b5655e72f463568df1aadf0\\\",\\\"vout\\\":1}]\"") +
2194  "\nList the locked transactions\n"
2195  + HelpExampleCli("listlockunspent", "") +
2196  "\nUnlock the transaction again\n"
2197  + HelpExampleCli("lockunspent", "true \"[{\\\"txid\\\":\\\"a08e6907dbbd3d809776dbfc5d82e371b764ed838b5655e72f463568df1aadf0\\\",\\\"vout\\\":1}]\"") +
2198  "\nAs a JSON-RPC call\n"
2199  + HelpExampleRpc("lockunspent", "false, \"[{\\\"txid\\\":\\\"a08e6907dbbd3d809776dbfc5d82e371b764ed838b5655e72f463568df1aadf0\\\",\\\"vout\\\":1}]\"")
2200  },
2201  }.ToString());
2202 
2203  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2204  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2205  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2206 
2207  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
2208  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
2209 
2210  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[0], UniValue::VBOOL);
2211 
2212  bool fUnlock = request.params[0].get_bool();
2213 
2214  if (request.params[1].isNull()) {
2215  if (fUnlock)
2216  pwallet->UnlockAllCoins();
2217  return true;
2218  }
2219 
2220  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[1], UniValue::VARR);
2221 
2222  const UniValue& output_params = request.params[1];
2223 
2224  // Create and validate the COutPoints first.
2225 
2226  std::vector<COutPoint> outputs;
2227  outputs.reserve(output_params.size());
2228 
2229  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < output_params.size(); idx++) {
2230  const UniValue& o = output_params[idx].get_obj();
2231 
2232  RPCTypeCheckObj(o,
2233  {
2234  {"txid", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
2235  {"vout", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
2236  });
2237 
2238  const uint256 txid(ParseHashO(o, "txid"));
2239  const int nOutput = find_value(o, "vout").get_int();
2240  if (nOutput < 0) {
2241  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, vout must be positive");
2242  }
2243 
2244  const COutPoint outpt(txid, nOutput);
2245 
2246  const auto it = pwallet->mapWallet.find(outpt.hash);
2247  if (it == pwallet->mapWallet.end()) {
2248  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, unknown transaction");
2249  }
2250 
2251  const CWalletTx& trans = it->second;
2252 
2253  if (outpt.n >= trans.tx->vout.size()) {
2254  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, vout index out of bounds");
2255  }
2256 
2257  if (pwallet->IsSpent(*locked_chain, outpt.hash, outpt.n)) {
2258  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, expected unspent output");
2259  }
2260 
2261  const bool is_locked = pwallet->IsLockedCoin(outpt.hash, outpt.n);
2262 
2263  if (fUnlock && !is_locked) {
2264  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, expected locked output");
2265  }
2266 
2267  if (!fUnlock && is_locked) {
2268  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, output already locked");
2269  }
2270 
2271  outputs.push_back(outpt);
2272  }
2273 
2274  // Atomically set (un)locked status for the outputs.
2275  for (const COutPoint& outpt : outputs) {
2276  if (fUnlock) pwallet->UnlockCoin(outpt);
2277  else pwallet->LockCoin(outpt);
2278  }
2279 
2280  return true;
2281 }

2340 static UniValue settxfee(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2341 {
2342  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2343  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2344 
2345  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2346  return NullUniValue;
2347  }
2348 
2349  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 1) {
2350  throw std::runtime_error(
2351  RPCHelpMan{"settxfee",
2352  "\nSet the transaction fee per kB for this wallet. Overrides the global -paytxfee command line parameter.\n",
2353  {
2354  {"amount", RPCArg::Type::AMOUNT, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The transaction fee in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB"},
2355  },
2356  RPCResult{
2357  "true|false (boolean) Returns true if successful\n"
2358  },
2359  RPCExamples{
2360  HelpExampleCli("settxfee", "0.00001")
2361  + HelpExampleRpc("settxfee", "0.00001")
2362  },
2363  }.ToString());
2364  }
2365 
2366  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
2367  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
2368 
2369  CAmount nAmount = AmountFromValue(request.params[0]);
2370  CFeeRate tx_fee_rate(nAmount, 1000);
2371  if (tx_fee_rate == 0) {
2372  // automatic selection
2373  } else if (tx_fee_rate < ::minRelayTxFee) {
2374  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("txfee cannot be less than min relay tx fee (%s)", ::minRelayTxFee.ToString()));
2375  } else if (tx_fee_rate < pwallet->m_min_fee) {
2376  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("txfee cannot be less than wallet min fee (%s)", pwallet->m_min_fee.ToString()));
2377  }
2378 
2379  pwallet->m_pay_tx_fee = tx_fee_rate;
2380  return true;
2381 }

2397  RPCResult{

2399  " \"walletname\": xxxxx, (string) the wallet name\n"
2400  " \"walletversion\": xxxxx, (numeric) the wallet version\n"

2402  " \"unconfirmed_balance\": xxx, (numeric) the total unconfirmed balance of the wallet in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "\n"
2403  " \"immature_balance\": xxxxxx, (numeric) the total immature balance of the wallet in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "\n"
2404  " \"txcount\": xxxxxxx, (numeric) the total number of transactions in the wallet\n"
2405  " \"keypoololdest\": xxxxxx, (numeric) the timestamp (seconds since Unix epoch) of the oldest pre-generated key in the key pool\n"
2406  " \"keypoolsize\": xxxx, (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated (only counts external keys)\n"

2409  " \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx, (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
2410  " \"hdseedid\": \"<hash160>\" (string, optional) the Hash160 of the HD seed (only present when HD is enabled)\n"
2411  " \"private_keys_enabled\": true|false (boolean) false if privatekeys are disabled for this wallet (enforced watch-only wallet)\n"
2412  "}\n"
2413  },
2414  RPCExamples{
2415  HelpExampleCli("getwalletinfo", "")
2416  + HelpExampleRpc("getwalletinfo", "")
2417  },
2418  }.ToString());
2419 
2420  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2421  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2422  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2423 
2424  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
2425  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
2426 
2427  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
2428 
2429  size_t kpExternalSize = pwallet->KeypoolCountExternalKeys();
2430  obj.pushKV("walletname", pwallet->GetName());
2431  obj.pushKV("walletversion", pwallet->GetVersion());
2432  obj.pushKV("balance", ValueFromAmount(pwallet->GetBalance()));
2433  obj.pushKV("unconfirmed_balance", ValueFromAmount(pwallet->GetUnconfirmedBalance()));
2434  obj.pushKV("immature_balance", ValueFromAmount(pwallet->GetImmatureBalance()));
2435  obj.pushKV("txcount", (int)pwallet->mapWallet.size());
2436  obj.pushKV("keypoololdest", pwallet->GetOldestKeyPoolTime());
2437  obj.pushKV("keypoolsize", (int64_t)kpExternalSize);
2438  CKeyID seed_id = pwallet->GetHDChain().seed_id;
2439  if (pwallet->CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT)) {
2440  obj.pushKV("keypoolsize_hd_internal", (int64_t)(pwallet->GetKeyPoolSize() - kpExternalSize));
2441  }

2443  obj.pushKV("unlocked_until", pwallet->nRelockTime);
2444  }
2445  obj.pushKV("paytxfee", ValueFromAmount(pwallet->m_pay_tx_fee.GetFeePerK()));
2446  if (!seed_id.IsNull()) {
2447  obj.pushKV("hdseedid", seed_id.GetHex());
2448  }
2449  obj.pushKV("private_keys_enabled", !pwallet->IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS));
2450  return obj;
2451 }

2524 static UniValue loadwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2525 {
2526  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 1)
2527  throw std::runtime_error(
2528  RPCHelpMan{"loadwallet",
2529  "\nLoads a wallet from a wallet file or directory."
2530  "\nNote that all wallet command-line options used when starting bitcoind will be"
2531  "\napplied to the new wallet (eg -zapwallettxes, upgradewallet, rescan, etc).\n",
2532  {
2533  {"filename", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The wallet directory or .dat file."},
2534  },
2535  RPCResult{
2536  "{\n"
2537  " \"name\" : <wallet_name>, (string) The wallet name if loaded successfully.\n"
2538  " \"warning\" : <warning>, (string) Warning message if wallet was not loaded cleanly.\n"
2539  "}\n"
2540  },
2541  RPCExamples{
2542  HelpExampleCli("loadwallet", "\"test.dat\"")
2543  + HelpExampleRpc("loadwallet", "\"test.dat\"")
2544  },
2545  }.ToString());
2546 
2547  WalletLocation location(request.params[0].get_str());
2548 
2549  if (!location.Exists()) {
2550  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_NOT_FOUND, "Wallet " + location.GetName() + " not found.");
2551  } else if (fs::is_directory(location.GetPath())) {
2552  // The given filename is a directory. Check that there's a wallet.dat file.
2553  fs::path wallet_dat_file = location.GetPath() / "wallet.dat";
2554  if (fs::symlink_status(wallet_dat_file).type() == fs::file_not_found) {
2555  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_NOT_FOUND, "Directory " + location.GetName() + " does not contain a wallet.dat file.");
2556  }
2557  }
2558 
2559  std::string error, warning;
2560  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = LoadWallet(*g_rpc_interfaces->chain, location, error, warning);
2561  if (!wallet) throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, error);
2562 
2563  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
2564  obj.pushKV("name", wallet->GetName());
2565  obj.pushKV("warning", warning);
2566 
2567  return obj;
2568 }

2570 static UniValue createwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2571 {
2572  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 3) {
2573  throw std::runtime_error(
2574  RPCHelpMan{"createwallet",
2575  "\nCreates and loads a new wallet.\n",
2576  {
2577  {"wallet_name", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The name for the new wallet. If this is a path, the wallet will be created at the path location."},
2578  {"disable_private_keys", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "false", "Disable the possibility of private keys (only watchonlys are possible in this mode)."},
2579  {"blank", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "false", "Create a blank wallet. A blank wallet has no keys or HD seed. One can be set using sethdseed."},
2580  },
2581  RPCResult{
2582  "{\n"
2583  " \"name\" : <wallet_name>, (string) The wallet name if created successfully. If the wallet was created using a full path, the wallet_name will be the full path.\n"
2584  " \"warning\" : <warning>, (string) Warning message if wallet was not loaded cleanly.\n"
2585  "}\n"
2586  },
2587  RPCExamples{
2588  HelpExampleCli("createwallet", "\"testwallet\"")
2589  + HelpExampleRpc("createwallet", "\"testwallet\"")
2590  },
2591  }.ToString());
2592  }
2593  std::string error;
2594  std::string warning;
2595 
2596  uint64_t flags = 0;
2597  if (!request.params[1].isNull() && request.params[1].get_bool()) {
2598  flags |= WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS;
2599  }
2600 
2601  if (!request.params[2].isNull() && request.params[2].get_bool()) {
2602  flags |= WALLET_FLAG_BLANK_WALLET;
2603  }
2604 
2605  WalletLocation location(request.params[0].get_str());
2606  if (location.Exists()) {
2607  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Wallet " + location.GetName() + " already exists.");
2608  }
2609 
2610  // Wallet::Verify will check if we're trying to create a wallet with a duplication name.
2611  if (!CWallet::Verify(*g_rpc_interfaces->chain, location, false, error, warning)) {
2612  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Wallet file verification failed: " + error);
2613  }
2614 
2615  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = CWallet::CreateWalletFromFile(*g_rpc_interfaces->chain, location, flags);
2616  if (!wallet) {
2617  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Wallet creation failed.");
2618  }
2619  AddWallet(wallet);
2620 
2621  wallet->postInitProcess();
2622 
2623  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
2624  obj.pushKV("name", wallet->GetName());
2625  obj.pushKV("warning", warning);
2626 
2627  return obj;
2628 }
2629 
2630 static UniValue unloadwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2631 {
2632  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 1) {
2633  throw std::runtime_error(
2634  RPCHelpMan{"unloadwallet",
2635  "Unloads the wallet referenced by the request endpoint otherwise unloads the wallet specified in the argument.\n"
2636  "Specifying the wallet name on a wallet endpoint is invalid.",
2637  {
2638  {"wallet_name", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "the wallet name from the RPC request", "The name of the wallet to unload."},
2639  },
2640  RPCResults{},
2641  RPCExamples{
2642  HelpExampleCli("unloadwallet", "wallet_name")
2643  + HelpExampleRpc("unloadwallet", "wallet_name")
2644  },
2645  }.ToString());
2646  }
2647 
2648  std::string wallet_name;
2649  if (GetWalletNameFromJSONRPCRequest(request, wallet_name)) {
2650  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
2651  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot unload the requested wallet");
2652  }
2653  } else {
2654  wallet_name = request.params[0].get_str();
2655  }
2656 
2657  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> wallet = GetWallet(wallet_name);
2658  if (!wallet) {
2659  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_NOT_FOUND, "Requested wallet does not exist or is not loaded");
2660  }
2661 
2662  // Release the "main" shared pointer and prevent further notifications.
2663  // Note that any attempt to load the same wallet would fail until the wallet
2664  // is destroyed (see CheckUniqueFileid).
2665  if (!RemoveWallet(wallet)) {
2666  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Requested wallet already unloaded");
2667  }
2668 
2669  UnloadWallet(std::move(wallet));
2670 
2671  return NullUniValue;
2672 }
2673 
2674 static UniValue resendwallettransactions(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2675 {
2676  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2677  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2678 
2679  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2680  return NullUniValue;
2681  }
2682 
2683  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 0)
2684  throw std::runtime_error(
2685  RPCHelpMan{"resendwallettransactions",
2686  "Immediately re-broadcast unconfirmed wallet transactions to all peers.\n"
2687  "Intended only for testing; the wallet code periodically re-broadcasts\n"
2688  "automatically.\n",
2689  {},
2690  RPCResult{
2691  "Returns an RPC error if -walletbroadcast is set to false.\n"
2692  "Returns array of transaction ids that were re-broadcast.\n"
2693  },
2694  RPCExamples{""},
2695  }.ToString()
2696  );
2697 
2698  if (!g_connman)
2699  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_CLIENT_P2P_DISABLED, "Error: Peer-to-peer functionality missing or disabled");
2700 
2701  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
2702  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
2703 
2704  if (!pwallet->GetBroadcastTransactions()) {
2705  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Error: Wallet transaction broadcasting is disabled with -walletbroadcast");
2706  }
2707 
2708  std::vector<uint256> txids = pwallet->ResendWalletTransactionsBefore(*locked_chain, GetTime(), g_connman.get());
2709  UniValue result(UniValue::VARR);
2710  for (const uint256& txid : txids)
2711  {
2712  result.push_back(txid.ToString());
2713  }
2714  return result;
2715 }

2717 static UniValue listunspent(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2718 {
2719  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2720  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2721 
2722  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2723  return NullUniValue;
2724  }
2725 
2726  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 5)
2727  throw std::runtime_error(
2728  RPCHelpMan{"listunspent",
2729  "\nReturns array of unspent transaction outputs\n"
2730  "with between minconf and maxconf (inclusive) confirmations.\n"
2731  "Optionally filter to only include txouts paid to specified addresses.\n",
2732  {
2733  {"minconf", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "1", "The minimum confirmations to filter"},
2734  {"maxconf", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "9999999", "The maximum confirmations to filter"},
2735  {"addresses", RPCArg::Type::ARR, /* default */ "empty array", "A json array of bitcoin addresses to filter",
2736  {
2737  {"address", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED, "bitcoin address"},
2738  },
2739  },
2740  {"include_unsafe", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "true", "Include outputs that are not safe to spend\n"
2741  " See description of \"safe\" attribute below."},
2742  {"query_options", RPCArg::Type::OBJ, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "JSON with query options",
2743  {
2744  {"minimumAmount", RPCArg::Type::AMOUNT, /* default */ "0", "Minimum value of each UTXO in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + ""},
2745  {"maximumAmount", RPCArg::Type::AMOUNT, /* default */ "unlimited", "Maximum value of each UTXO in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + ""},
2746  {"maximumCount", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "unlimited", "Maximum number of UTXOs"},
2747  {"minimumSumAmount", RPCArg::Type::AMOUNT, /* default */ "unlimited", "Minimum sum value of all UTXOs in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + ""},
2748  },
2749  "query_options"},
2750  },
2751  RPCResult{
2752  "[ (array of json object)\n"
2753  " {\n"
2754  " \"txid\" : \"txid\", (string) the transaction id \n"
2755  " \"vout\" : n, (numeric) the vout value\n"
2756  " \"address\" : \"address\", (string) the bitcoin address\n"
2757  " \"label\" : \"label\", (string) The associated label, or \"\" for the default label\n"
2758  " \"scriptPubKey\" : \"key\", (string) the script key\n"
2759  " \"amount\" : x.xxx, (numeric) the transaction output amount in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "\n"
2760  " \"confirmations\" : n, (numeric) The number of confirmations\n"
2761  " \"redeemScript\" : \"script\" (string) The redeemScript if scriptPubKey is P2SH"
2762  " \"witnessScript\" : \"script\" (string) witnessScript if the scriptPubKey is P2WSH or P2SH-P2WSH\n"
2763  " \"spendable\" : xxx, (bool) Whether we have the private keys to spend this output\n"
2764  " \"solvable\" : xxx, (bool) Whether we know how to spend this output, ignoring the lack of keys\n"
2765  " \"desc\" : xxx, (string, only when solvable) A descriptor for spending this output\n"
2766  " \"safe\" : xxx (bool) Whether this output is considered safe to spend. Unconfirmed transactions\n"
2767  " from outside keys and unconfirmed replacement transactions are considered unsafe\n"
2768  " and are not eligible for spending by fundrawtransaction and sendtoaddress.\n"
2769  " }\n"
2770  " ,...\n"
2771  "]\n"
2772  },
2773  RPCExamples{
2774  HelpExampleCli("listunspent", "")
2775  + HelpExampleCli("listunspent", "6 9999999 \"[\\\"1PGFqEzfmQch1gKD3ra4k18PNj3tTUUSqg\\\",\\\"1LtvqCaApEdUGFkpKMM4MstjcaL4dKg8SP\\\"]\"")
2776  + HelpExampleRpc("listunspent", "6, 9999999 \"[\\\"1PGFqEzfmQch1gKD3ra4k18PNj3tTUUSqg\\\",\\\"1LtvqCaApEdUGFkpKMM4MstjcaL4dKg8SP\\\"]\"")
2777  + HelpExampleCli("listunspent", "6 9999999 '[]' true '{ \"minimumAmount\": 0.005 }'")
2778  + HelpExampleRpc("listunspent", "6, 9999999, [] , true, { \"minimumAmount\": 0.005 } ")
2779  },
2780  }.ToString());
2781 
2782  int nMinDepth = 1;
2783  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
2784  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[0], UniValue::VNUM);
2785  nMinDepth = request.params[0].get_int();
2786  }
2787 
2788  int nMaxDepth = 9999999;
2789  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
2790  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[1], UniValue::VNUM);
2791  nMaxDepth = request.params[1].get_int();
2792  }
2793 
2794  std::set<CTxDestination> destinations;
2795  if (!request.params[2].isNull()) {
2796  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[2], UniValue::VARR);
2797  UniValue inputs = request.params[2].get_array();
2798  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < inputs.size(); idx++) {
2799  const UniValue& input = inputs[idx];
2800  CTxDestination dest = DecodeDestination(input.get_str());
2801  if (!IsValidDestination(dest)) {
2802  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, std::string("Invalid Bitcoin address: ") + input.get_str());
2803  }
2804  if (!destinations.insert(dest).second) {
2805  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, std::string("Invalid parameter, duplicated address: ") + input.get_str());
2806  }
2807  }
2808  }
2809 
2810  bool include_unsafe = true;
2811  if (!request.params[3].isNull()) {
2812  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[3], UniValue::VBOOL);
2813  include_unsafe = request.params[3].get_bool();
2814  }
2815 
2816  CAmount nMinimumAmount = 0;
2817  CAmount nMaximumAmount = MAX_MONEY;
2818  CAmount nMinimumSumAmount = MAX_MONEY;
2819  uint64_t nMaximumCount = 0;
2820 
2821  if (!request.params[4].isNull()) {
2822  const UniValue& options = request.params[4].get_obj();
2823 
2824  if (options.exists("minimumAmount"))
2825  nMinimumAmount = AmountFromValue(options["minimumAmount"]);
2826 
2827  if (options.exists("maximumAmount"))
2828  nMaximumAmount = AmountFromValue(options["maximumAmount"]);
2829 
2830  if (options.exists("minimumSumAmount"))
2831  nMinimumSumAmount = AmountFromValue(options["minimumSumAmount"]);
2832 
2833  if (options.exists("maximumCount"))
2834  nMaximumCount = options["maximumCount"].get_int64();
2835  }
2836 
2837  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2838  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2839  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2840 
2841  UniValue results(UniValue::VARR);
2842  std::vector<COutput> vecOutputs;
2843  {
2844  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
2845  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
2846  pwallet->AvailableCoins(*locked_chain, vecOutputs, !include_unsafe, nullptr, nMinimumAmount, nMaximumAmount, nMinimumSumAmount, nMaximumCount, nMinDepth, nMaxDepth);
2847  }
2848 
2849  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
2850 
2851  for (const COutput& out : vecOutputs) {
2852  CTxDestination address;
2853  const CScript& scriptPubKey = out.tx->tx->vout[out.i].scriptPubKey;
2854  bool fValidAddress = ExtractDestination(scriptPubKey, address);
2855 
2856  if (destinations.size() && (!fValidAddress || !destinations.count(address)))
2857  continue;
2858 
2859  UniValue entry(UniValue::VOBJ);
2860  entry.pushKV("txid", out.tx->GetHash().GetHex());
2861  entry.pushKV("vout", out.i);
2862 
2863  if (fValidAddress) {
2864  entry.pushKV("address", EncodeDestination(address));
2865 
2866  auto i = pwallet->mapAddressBook.find(address);
2867  if (i != pwallet->mapAddressBook.end()) {
2868  entry.pushKV("label", i->second.name);
2869  }
2870 
2871  if (scriptPubKey.IsPayToScriptHash()) {
2872  const CScriptID& hash = boost::get<CScriptID>(address);
2873  CScript redeemScript;
2874  if (pwallet->GetCScript(hash, redeemScript)) {
2875  entry.pushKV("redeemScript", HexStr(redeemScript.begin(), redeemScript.end()));
2876  // Now check if the redeemScript is actually a P2WSH script
2877  CTxDestination witness_destination;
2878  if (redeemScript.IsPayToWitnessScriptHash()) {
2879  bool extracted = ExtractDestination(redeemScript, witness_destination);
2880  assert(extracted);
2881  // Also return the witness script
2882  const WitnessV0ScriptHash& whash = boost::get<WitnessV0ScriptHash>(witness_destination);
2883  CScriptID id;
2884  CRIPEMD160().Write(whash.begin(), whash.size()).Finalize(id.begin());
2885  CScript witnessScript;
2886  if (pwallet->GetCScript(id, witnessScript)) {
2887  entry.pushKV("witnessScript", HexStr(witnessScript.begin(), witnessScript.end()));
2888  }
2889  }
2890  }
2891  } else if (scriptPubKey.IsPayToWitnessScriptHash()) {
2892  const WitnessV0ScriptHash& whash = boost::get<WitnessV0ScriptHash>(address);
2893  CScriptID id;
2894  CRIPEMD160().Write(whash.begin(), whash.size()).Finalize(id.begin());
2895  CScript witnessScript;
2896  if (pwallet->GetCScript(id, witnessScript)) {
2897  entry.pushKV("witnessScript", HexStr(witnessScript.begin(), witnessScript.end()));
2898  }
2899  }
2900  }
2901 
2902  entry.pushKV("scriptPubKey", HexStr(scriptPubKey.begin(), scriptPubKey.end()));
2903  entry.pushKV("amount", ValueFromAmount(out.tx->tx->vout[out.i].nValue));
2904  entry.pushKV("confirmations", out.nDepth);
2905  entry.pushKV("spendable", out.fSpendable);
2906  entry.pushKV("solvable", out.fSolvable);
2907  if (out.fSolvable) {
2908  auto descriptor = InferDescriptor(scriptPubKey, *pwallet);
2909  entry.pushKV("desc", descriptor->ToString());
2910  }
2911  entry.pushKV("safe", out.fSafe);
2912  results.push_back(entry);
2913  }
2914 
2915  return results;
2916 }
2917 
2918 void FundTransaction(CWallet* const pwallet, CMutableTransaction& tx, CAmount& fee_out, int& change_position, UniValue options)
2919 {
2920  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2921  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2922  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2923 
2924  CCoinControl coinControl;
2925  change_position = -1;
2926  bool lockUnspents = false;
2927  UniValue subtractFeeFromOutputs;
2928  std::set<int> setSubtractFeeFromOutputs;
2929 
2930  if (!options.isNull()) {
2931  if (options.type() == UniValue::VBOOL) {
2932  // backward compatibility bool only fallback
2933  coinControl.fAllowWatchOnly = options.get_bool();
2934  }
2935  else {
2936  RPCTypeCheckArgument(options, UniValue::VOBJ);
2937  RPCTypeCheckObj(options,
2938  {
2939  {"changeAddress", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
2940  {"changePosition", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
2941  {"change_type", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
2942  {"includeWatching", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
2943  {"lockUnspents", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
2944  {"feeRate", UniValueType()}, // will be checked below
2945  {"subtractFeeFromOutputs", UniValueType(UniValue::VARR)},
2946  {"replaceable", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
2947  {"conf_target", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
2948  {"estimate_mode", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
2949  },
2950  true, true);
2951 
2952  if (options.exists("changeAddress")) {
2953  CTxDestination dest = DecodeDestination(options["changeAddress"].get_str());
2954 
2955  if (!IsValidDestination(dest)) {
2956  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "changeAddress must be a valid bitcoin address");
2957  }
2958 
2959  coinControl.destChange = dest;
2960  }
2961 
2962  if (options.exists("changePosition"))
2963  change_position = options["changePosition"].get_int();
2964 
2965  if (options.exists("change_type")) {
2966  if (options.exists("changeAddress")) {
2967  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot specify both changeAddress and address_type options");
2968  }
2969  coinControl.m_change_type = pwallet->m_default_change_type;
2970  if (!ParseOutputType(options["change_type"].get_str(), *coinControl.m_change_type)) {
2971  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, strprintf("Unknown change type '%s'", options["change_type"].get_str()));
2972  }
2973  }
2974 
2975  if (options.exists("includeWatching"))
2976  coinControl.fAllowWatchOnly = options["includeWatching"].get_bool();
2977 
2978  if (options.exists("lockUnspents"))
2979  lockUnspents = options["lockUnspents"].get_bool();
2980 
2981  if (options.exists("feeRate"))
2982  {
2983  coinControl.m_feerate = CFeeRate(AmountFromValue(options["feeRate"]));
2984  coinControl.fOverrideFeeRate = true;
2985  }
2986 
2987  if (options.exists("subtractFeeFromOutputs"))
2988  subtractFeeFromOutputs = options["subtractFeeFromOutputs"].get_array();
2989 
2990  if (options.exists("replaceable")) {
2991  coinControl.m_signal_bip125_rbf = options["replaceable"].get_bool();
2992  }
2993  if (options.exists("conf_target")) {
2994  if (options.exists("feeRate")) {
2995  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot specify both conf_target and feeRate");
2996  }
2997  coinControl.m_confirm_target = ParseConfirmTarget(options["conf_target"]);
2998  }
2999  if (options.exists("estimate_mode")) {
3000  if (options.exists("feeRate")) {
3001  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot specify both estimate_mode and feeRate");
3002  }
3003  if (!FeeModeFromString(options["estimate_mode"].get_str(), coinControl.m_fee_mode)) {
3004  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid estimate_mode parameter");
3005  }
3006  }
3007  }
3008  }
3009 
3010  if (tx.vout.size() == 0)
3011  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "TX must have at least one output");
3012 
3013  if (change_position != -1 && (change_position < 0 || (unsigned int)change_position > tx.vout.size()))
3014  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "changePosition out of bounds");
3015 
3016  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < subtractFeeFromOutputs.size(); idx++) {
3017  int pos = subtractFeeFromOutputs[idx].get_int();
3018  if (setSubtractFeeFromOutputs.count(pos))
3019  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid parameter, duplicated position: %d", pos));
3020  if (pos < 0)
3021  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid parameter, negative position: %d", pos));
3022  if (pos >= int(tx.vout.size()))
3023  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid parameter, position too large: %d", pos));
3024  setSubtractFeeFromOutputs.insert(pos);
3025  }
3026 
3027  std::string strFailReason;
3028 
3029  if (!pwallet->FundTransaction(tx, fee_out, change_position, strFailReason, lockUnspents, setSubtractFeeFromOutputs, coinControl)) {
3030  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, strFailReason);
3031  }
3032 }
3033 
3034 static UniValue fundrawtransaction(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3035 {
3036  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3037  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3038 
3039  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3040  return NullUniValue;
3041  }
3042 
3043  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 3)
3044  throw std::runtime_error(
3045  RPCHelpMan{"fundrawtransaction",
3046  "\nAdd inputs to a transaction until it has enough in value to meet its out value.\n"
3047  "This will not modify existing inputs, and will add at most one change output to the outputs.\n"
3048  "No existing outputs will be modified unless \"subtractFeeFromOutputs\" is specified.\n"
3049  "Note that inputs which were signed may need to be resigned after completion since in/outputs have been added.\n"
3050  "The inputs added will not be signed, use signrawtransactionwithkey\n"
3051  " or signrawtransactionwithwallet for that.\n"
3052  "Note that all existing inputs must have their previous output transaction be in the wallet.\n"
3053  "Note that all inputs selected must be of standard form and P2SH scripts must be\n"
3054  "in the wallet using importaddress or addmultisigaddress (to calculate fees).\n"
3055  "You can see whether this is the case by checking the \"solvable\" field in the listunspent output.\n"
3056  "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n",
3057  {
3058  {"hexstring", RPCArg::Type::STR_HEX, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The hex string of the raw transaction"},
3059  {"options", RPCArg::Type::OBJ, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "for backward compatibility: passing in a true instead of an object will result in {\"includeWatching\":true}",
3060  {
3061  {"changeAddress", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "pool address", "The bitcoin address to receive the change"},
3062  {"changePosition", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "random", "The index of the change output"},
3063  {"change_type", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "set by -changetype", "The output type to use. Only valid if changeAddress is not specified. Options are \"legacy\", \"p2sh-segwit\", and \"bech32\"."},
3064  {"includeWatching", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "false", "Also select inputs which are watch only"},
3065  {"lockUnspents", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "false", "Lock selected unspent outputs"},
3066  {"feeRate", RPCArg::Type::AMOUNT, /* default */ "not set: makes wallet determine the fee", "Set a specific fee rate in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB"},
3067  {"subtractFeeFromOutputs", RPCArg::Type::ARR, /* default */ "empty array", "A json array of integers.\n"
3068  " The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each specified output.\n"
3069  " Those recipients will receive less bitcoins than you enter in their corresponding amount field.\n"
3070  " If no outputs are specified here, the sender pays the fee.",
3071  {
3072  {"vout_index", RPCArg::Type::NUM, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED, "The zero-based output index, before a change output is added."},
3073  },
3074  },
3075  {"replaceable", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "fallback to wallet's default", "Marks this transaction as BIP125 replaceable.\n"
3076  " Allows this transaction to be replaced by a transaction with higher fees"},
3077  {"conf_target", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "fallback to wallet's default", "Confirmation target (in blocks)"},
3078  {"estimate_mode", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "UNSET", "The fee estimate mode, must be one of:\n"
3079  " \"UNSET\"\n"
3080  " \"ECONOMICAL\"\n"
3081  " \"CONSERVATIVE\""},
3082  },
3083  "options"},

3114  }

3117  int change_position;
3118  FundTransaction(pwallet, tx, fee, change_position, request.params[1]);
3119

3122  result.pushKV("fee", ValueFromAmount(fee));
3123  result.pushKV("changepos", change_position);
3124

3205 static UniValue bumpfee(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3206 {
3207  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3208  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3209 
3210 
3211  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp))
3212  return NullUniValue;
3213 
3214  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 2) {
3215  throw std::runtime_error(

3217  "\nBumps the fee of an opt-in-RBF transaction T, replacing it with a new transaction B.\n"
3218  "An opt-in RBF transaction with the given txid must be in the wallet.\n"
3219  "The command will pay the additional fee by decreasing (or perhaps removing) its change output.\n"
3220  "If the change output is not big enough to cover the increased fee, the command will currently fail\n"
3221  "instead of adding new inputs to compensate. (A future implementation could improve this.)\n"
3222  "The command will fail if the wallet or mempool contains a transaction that spends one of T's outputs.\n"
3223  "By default, the new fee will be calculated automatically using estimatesmartfee.\n"
3224  "The user can specify a confirmation target for estimatesmartfee.\n"
3225  "Alternatively, the user can specify totalFee, or use RPC settxfee to set a higher fee rate.\n"
3226  "At a minimum, the new fee rate must be high enough to pay an additional new relay fee (incrementalfee\n"
3227  "returned by getnetworkinfo) to enter the node's mempool.\n",
3228  {
3229  {"txid", RPCArg::Type::STR_HEX, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The txid to be bumped"},
3230  {"options", RPCArg::Type::OBJ, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "",
3231  {
3232  {"confTarget", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "fallback to wallet's default", "Confirmation target (in blocks)"},
3233  {"totalFee", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "fallback to 'confTarget'", "Total fee (NOT feerate) to pay, in satoshis.\n"
3234  " In rare cases, the actual fee paid might be slightly higher than the specified\n"
3235  " totalFee if the tx change output has to be removed because it is too close to\n"
3236  " the dust threshold."},
3237  {"replaceable", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "true", "Whether the new transaction should still be\n"
3238  " marked bip-125 replaceable. If true, the sequence numbers in the transaction will\n"
3239  " be left unchanged from the original. If false, any input sequence numbers in the\n"
3240  " original transaction that were less than 0xfffffffe will be increased to 0xfffffffe\n"
3241  " so the new transaction will not be explicitly bip-125 replaceable (though it may\n"
3242  " still be replaceable in practice, for example if it has unconfirmed ancestors which\n"
3243  " are replaceable)."},
3244  {"estimate_mode", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "UNSET", "The fee estimate mode, must be one of:\n"
3245  " \"UNSET\"\n"
3246  " \"ECONOMICAL\"\n"
3247  " \"CONSERVATIVE\""},
3248  },
3249  "options"},
3250  },
3251  RPCResult{
3252  "{\n"
3253  " \"txid\": \"value\", (string) The id of the new transaction\n"
3254  " \"origfee\": n, (numeric) Fee of the replaced transaction\n"
3255  " \"fee\": n, (numeric) Fee of the new transaction\n"
3256  " \"errors\": [ str... ] (json array of strings) Errors encountered during processing (may be empty)\n"
3257  "}\n"

3267  uint256 hash(ParseHashV(request.params[0], "txid"));
3268

3270  CAmount totalFee = 0;
3271  CCoinControl coin_control;
3272  coin_control.m_signal_bip125_rbf = true;
3273  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
3274  UniValue options = request.params[1];
3275  RPCTypeCheckObj(options,
3276  {
3277  {"confTarget", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
3278  {"totalFee", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
3279  {"replaceable", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
3280  {"estimate_mode", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
3281  },
3282  true, true);
3283 
3284  if (options.exists("confTarget") && options.exists("totalFee")) {
3285  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "confTarget and totalFee options should not both be set. Please provide either a confirmation target for fee estimation or an explicit total fee for the transaction.");
3286  } else if (options.exists("confTarget")) { // TODO: alias this to conf_target
3287  coin_control.m_confirm_target = ParseConfirmTarget(options["confTarget"]);
3288  } else if (options.exists("totalFee")) {
3289  totalFee = options["totalFee"].get_int64();
3290  if (totalFee <= 0) {
3291  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid totalFee %s (must be greater than 0)", FormatMoney(totalFee)));
3292  }
3293  }
3294 
3295  if (options.exists("replaceable")) {
3296  coin_control.m_signal_bip125_rbf = options["replaceable"].get_bool();
3297  }
3298  if (options.exists("estimate_mode")) {
3299  if (!FeeModeFromString(options["estimate_mode"].get_str(), coin_control.m_fee_mode)) {
3300  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid estimate_mode parameter");
3301  }
3302  }
3303  }
3304 
3305  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
3306  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
3307  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
3308 
3309  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
3310  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
3311  EnsureWalletIsUnlocked(pwallet);
3312 
3313 
3314  std::vector<std::string> errors;
3315  CAmount old_fee;
3316  CAmount new_fee;
3317  CMutableTransaction mtx;
3318  feebumper::Result res = feebumper::CreateTransaction(pwallet, hash, coin_control, totalFee, errors, old_fee, new_fee, mtx);
3319  if (res != feebumper::Result::OK) {
3320  switch(res) {
3321  case feebumper::Result::INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY:
3322  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, errors[0]);
3323  break;
3324  case feebumper::Result::INVALID_REQUEST:
3325  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_REQUEST, errors[0]);
3326  break;
3327  case feebumper::Result::INVALID_PARAMETER:
3328  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, errors[0]);
3329  break;
3330  case feebumper::Result::WALLET_ERROR:
3331  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, errors[0]);
3332  break;
3333  default:
3334  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, errors[0]);
3335  break;
3336  }
3337  }
3338 
3339  // sign bumped transaction
3340  if (!feebumper::SignTransaction(pwallet, mtx)) {
3341  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Can't sign transaction.");
3342  }
3343  // commit the bumped transaction
3344  uint256 txid;
3345  if (feebumper::CommitTransaction(pwallet, hash, std::move(mtx), errors, txid) != feebumper::Result::OK) {
3346  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, errors[0]);
3347  }
3348  UniValue result(UniValue::VOBJ);
3349  result.pushKV("txid", txid.GetHex());
3350  result.pushKV("origfee", ValueFromAmount(old_fee));
3351  result.pushKV("fee", ValueFromAmount(new_fee));
3352  UniValue result_errors(UniValue::VARR);
3353  for (const std::string& error : errors) {
3354  result_errors.push_back(error);
3355  }
3356  result.pushKV("errors", result_errors);
3357 
3358  return result;
3359 }

3365 
3366

3391  "To use generate in v0.18, restart bitcoind with -deprecatedrpc=generate.\n"
3392  "Clients should transition to using the node rpc method generatetoaddress\n");
3393  }

3397  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
3398  max_tries = request.params[1].get_int();
3399  }
3400 
3401  std::shared_ptr<CReserveScript> coinbase_script;
3402  pwallet->GetScriptForMining(coinbase_script);
3403 
3404  // If the keypool is exhausted, no script is returned at all. Catch this.
3405  if (!coinbase_script) {
3406  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_KEYPOOL_RAN_OUT, "Error: Keypool ran out, please call keypoolrefill first");
3407  }
3408 
3409  //throw an error if no script was provided
3410  if (coinbase_script->reserveScript.empty()) {
3411  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INTERNAL_ERROR, "No coinbase script available");
3412  }
3413 
3414  return generateBlocks(coinbase_script, num_generate, max_tries, true);
3415 }

3417 UniValue rescanblockchain(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3418 {
3419  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3420  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3421 
3422  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3423  return NullUniValue;
3424  }
3425 
3426  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 2) {
3427  throw std::runtime_error(
3428  RPCHelpMan{"rescanblockchain",
3429  "\nRescan the local blockchain for wallet related transactions.\n",
3430  {
3431  {"start_height", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "0", "block height where the rescan should start"},
3432  {"stop_height", RPCArg::Type::NUM, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "the last block height that should be scanned. If none is provided it will rescan up to the tip at return time of this call."},
3433  },
3434  RPCResult{
3435  "{\n"
3436  " \"start_height\" (numeric) The block height where the rescan started (the requested height or 0)\n"
3437  " \"stop_height\" (numeric) The height of the last rescanned block. May be null in rare cases if there was a reorg and the call didn't scan any blocks because they were already scanned in the background.\n"
3438  "}\n"
3439  },
3440  RPCExamples{
3441  HelpExampleCli("rescanblockchain", "100000 120000")
3442  + HelpExampleRpc("rescanblockchain", "100000, 120000")
3443  },
3444  }.ToString());
3445  }
3446 
3447  WalletRescanReserver reserver(pwallet);
3448  if (!reserver.reserve()) {
3449  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Wallet is currently rescanning. Abort existing rescan or wait.");
3450  }
3451 
3452  int start_height = 0;
3453  uint256 start_block, stop_block;
3454  {
3455  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
3456  Optional<int> tip_height = locked_chain->getHeight();
3457 
3458  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
3459  start_height = request.params[0].get_int();
3460  if (start_height < 0 || !tip_height || start_height > *tip_height) {
3461  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid start_height");
3462  }
3463  }
3464 
3465  Optional<int> stop_height;
3466  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
3467  stop_height = request.params[1].get_int();
3468  if (*stop_height < 0 || !tip_height || *stop_height > *tip_height) {
3469  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid stop_height");
3470  }
3471  else if (*stop_height < start_height) {
3472  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "stop_height must be greater than start_height");
3473  }
3474  }
3475 
3476  // We can't rescan beyond non-pruned blocks, stop and throw an error
3477  if (locked_chain->findPruned(start_height, stop_height)) {
3478  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Can't rescan beyond pruned data. Use RPC call getblockchaininfo to determine your pruned height.");
3479  }
3480 
3481  if (tip_height) {
3482  start_block = locked_chain->getBlockHash(start_height);
3483  // If called with a stop_height, set the stop_height here to
3484  // trigger a rescan to that height.
3485  // If called without a stop height, leave stop_height as null here
3486  // so rescan continues to the tip (even if the tip advances during
3487  // rescan).
3488  if (stop_height) {
3489  stop_block = locked_chain->getBlockHash(*stop_height);
3490  }
3491  }
3492  }
3493 
3494  CWallet::ScanResult result =
3495  pwallet->ScanForWalletTransactions(start_block, stop_block, reserver, true /* fUpdate */);
3496  switch (result.status) {
3497  case CWallet::ScanResult::SUCCESS:
3498  break;
3499  case CWallet::ScanResult::FAILURE:
3500  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Rescan failed. Potentially corrupted data files.");
3501  case CWallet::ScanResult::USER_ABORT:
3502  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Rescan aborted.");
3503  // no default case, so the compiler can warn about missing cases
3504  }
3505  UniValue response(UniValue::VOBJ);
3506  response.pushKV("start_height", start_height);
3507  response.pushKV("stop_height", result.last_scanned_height ? *result.last_scanned_height : UniValue());
3508  return response;
3509 }
3510 
3511 class DescribeWalletAddressVisitor : public boost::static_visitor<UniValue>
3512 {
3513 public:
3514  CWallet * const pwallet;
3515 
3516  void ProcessSubScript(const CScript& subscript, UniValue& obj, bool include_addresses = false) const
3517  {
3518  // Always present: script type and redeemscript
3519  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned char>> solutions_data;
3520  txnouttype which_type = Solver(subscript, solutions_data);
3521  obj.pushKV("script", GetTxnOutputType(which_type));
3522  obj.pushKV("hex", HexStr(subscript.begin(), subscript.end()));
3523 
3524  CTxDestination embedded;
3525  UniValue a(UniValue::VARR);
3526  if (ExtractDestination(subscript, embedded)) {
3527  // Only when the script corresponds to an address.
3528  UniValue subobj(UniValue::VOBJ);
3529  UniValue detail = DescribeAddress(embedded);
3530  subobj.pushKVs(detail);
3531  UniValue wallet_detail = boost::apply_visitor(*this, embedded);
3532  subobj.pushKVs(wallet_detail);
3533  subobj.pushKV("address", EncodeDestination(embedded));
3534  subobj.pushKV("scriptPubKey", HexStr(subscript.begin(), subscript.end()));
3535  // Always report the pubkey at the top level, so that `getnewaddress()['pubkey']` always works.
3536  if (subobj.exists("pubkey")) obj.pushKV("pubkey", subobj["pubkey"]);
3537  obj.pushKV("embedded", std::move(subobj));
3538  if (include_addresses) a.push_back(EncodeDestination(embedded));
3539  } else if (which_type == TX_MULTISIG) {
3540  // Also report some information on multisig scripts (which do not have a corresponding address).
3541  // TODO: abstract out the common functionality between this logic and ExtractDestinations.
3542  obj.pushKV("sigsrequired", solutions_data[0][0]);
3543  UniValue pubkeys(UniValue::VARR);
3544  for (size_t i = 1; i < solutions_data.size() - 1; ++i) {
3545  CPubKey key(solutions_data[i].begin(), solutions_data[i].end());
3546  if (include_addresses) a.push_back(EncodeDestination(key.GetID()));
3547  pubkeys.push_back(HexStr(key.begin(), key.end()));
3548  }
3549  obj.pushKV("pubkeys", std::move(pubkeys));
3550  }
3551 
3552  // The "addresses" field is confusing because it refers to public keys using their P2PKH address.
3553  // For that reason, only add the 'addresses' field when needed for backward compatibility. New applications
3554  // can use the 'embedded'->'address' field for P2SH or P2WSH wrapped addresses, and 'pubkeys' for
3555  // inspecting multisig participants.
3556  if (include_addresses) obj.pushKV("addresses", std::move(a));
3557  }
3558 
3559  explicit DescribeWalletAddressVisitor(CWallet* _pwallet) : pwallet(_pwallet) {}
3560 
3561  UniValue operator()(const CNoDestination& dest) const { return UniValue(UniValue::VOBJ); }
3562 
3563  UniValue operator()(const CKeyID& keyID) const
3564  {
3565  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
3566  CPubKey vchPubKey;
3567  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetPubKey(keyID, vchPubKey)) {
3568  obj.pushKV("pubkey", HexStr(vchPubKey));
3569  obj.pushKV("iscompressed", vchPubKey.IsCompressed());
3570  }
3571  return obj;
3572  }
3573 
3574  UniValue operator()(const CScriptID& scriptID) const
3575  {
3576  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
3577  CScript subscript;
3578  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetCScript(scriptID, subscript)) {
3579  ProcessSubScript(subscript, obj, IsDeprecatedRPCEnabled("validateaddress"));
3580  }
3581  return obj;
3582  }
3583 
3584  UniValue operator()(const WitnessV0KeyHash& id) const
3585  {
3586  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
3587  CPubKey pubkey;
3588  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetPubKey(CKeyID(id), pubkey)) {
3589  obj.pushKV("pubkey", HexStr(pubkey));
3590  }
3591  return obj;
3592  }
3593 
3594  UniValue operator()(const WitnessV0ScriptHash& id) const
3595  {
3596  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
3597  CScript subscript;
3598  CRIPEMD160 hasher;
3599  uint160 hash;
3600  hasher.Write(id.begin(), 32).Finalize(hash.begin());
3601  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetCScript(CScriptID(hash), subscript)) {
3602  ProcessSubScript(subscript, obj);
3603  }
3604  return obj;
3605  }
3606 
3607  UniValue operator()(const WitnessUnknown& id) const { return UniValue(UniValue::VOBJ); }
3608 };
3609 
3610 static UniValue DescribeWalletAddress(CWallet* pwallet, const CTxDestination& dest)
3611 {
3612  UniValue ret(UniValue::VOBJ);
3613  UniValue detail = DescribeAddress(dest);
3614  ret.pushKVs(detail);
3615  ret.pushKVs(boost::apply_visitor(DescribeWalletAddressVisitor(pwallet), dest));
3616  return ret;
3617 }

3630 UniValue getaddressinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3631 {
3632  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3633  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3634 
3635  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3636  return NullUniValue;
3637  }
3638 
3639  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 1) {
3640  throw std::runtime_error(
3641  RPCHelpMan{"getaddressinfo",
3642  "\nReturn information about the given bitcoin address. Some information requires the address\n"
3643  "to be in the wallet.\n",
3644  {
3645  {"address", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The bitcoin address to get the information of."},
3646  },
3647  RPCResult{
3648  "{\n"
3649  " \"address\" : \"address\", (string) The bitcoin address validated\n"
3650  " \"scriptPubKey\" : \"hex\", (string) The hex-encoded scriptPubKey generated by the address\n"
3651  " \"ismine\" : true|false, (boolean) If the address is yours or not\n"
3652  " \"iswatchonly\" : true|false, (boolean) If the address is watchonly\n"
3653  " \"solvable\" : true|false, (boolean) Whether we know how to spend coins sent to this address, ignoring the possible lack of private keys\n"
3654  " \"desc\" : \"desc\", (string, optional) A descriptor for spending coins sent to this address (only when solvable)\n"
3655  " \"isscript\" : true|false, (boolean) If the key is a script\n"
3656  " \"ischange\" : true|false, (boolean) If the address was used for change output\n"
3657  " \"iswitness\" : true|false, (boolean) If the address is a witness address\n"
3658  " \"witness_version\" : version (numeric, optional) The version number of the witness program\n"
3659  " \"witness_program\" : \"hex\" (string, optional) The hex value of the witness program\n"
3660  " \"script\" : \"type\" (string, optional) The output script type. Only if \"isscript\" is true and the redeemscript is known. Possible types: nonstandard, pubkey, pubkeyhash, scripthash, multisig, nulldata, witness_v0_keyhash, witness_v0_scripthash, witness_unknown\n"
3661  " \"hex\" : \"hex\", (string, optional) The redeemscript for the p2sh address\n"
3662  " \"pubkeys\" (string, optional) Array of pubkeys associated with the known redeemscript (only if \"script\" is \"multisig\")\n"
3663  " [\n"
3664  " \"pubkey\"\n"
3665  " ,...\n"
3666  " ]\n"
3667  " \"sigsrequired\" : xxxxx (numeric, optional) Number of signatures required to spend multisig output (only if \"script\" is \"multisig\")\n"
3668  " \"pubkey\" : \"publickeyhex\", (string, optional) The hex value of the raw public key, for single-key addresses (possibly embedded in P2SH or P2WSH)\n"
3669  " \"embedded\" : {...}, (object, optional) Information about the address embedded in P2SH or P2WSH, if relevant and known. It includes all getaddressinfo output fields for the embedded address, excluding metadata (\"timestamp\", \"hdkeypath\", \"hdseedid\") and relation to the wallet (\"ismine\", \"iswatchonly\").\n"
3670  " \"iscompressed\" : true|false, (boolean, optional) If the pubkey is compressed\n"
3671  " \"label\" : \"label\" (string) The label associated with the address, \"\" is the default label\n"
3672  " \"timestamp\" : timestamp, (number, optional) The creation time of the key if available in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)\n"
3673  " \"hdkeypath\" : \"keypath\" (string, optional) The HD keypath if the key is HD and available\n"
3674  " \"hdseedid\" : \"<hash160>\" (string, optional) The Hash160 of the HD seed\n"
3675  " \"hdmasterfingerprint\" : \"<hash160>\" (string, optional) The fingperint of the master key.\n"
3676  " \"labels\" (object) Array of labels associated with the address.\n"
3677  " [\n"
3678  " { (json object of label data)\n"
3679  " \"name\": \"labelname\" (string) The label\n"
3680  " \"purpose\": \"string\" (string) Purpose of address (\"send\" for sending address, \"receive\" for receiving address)\n"
3681  " },...\n"
3682  " ]\n"
3683  "}\n"
3684  },
3685  RPCExamples{
3686  HelpExampleCli("getaddressinfo", "\"1PSSGeFHDnKNxiEyFrD1wcEaHr9hrQDDWc\"")
3687  + HelpExampleRpc("getaddressinfo", "\"1PSSGeFHDnKNxiEyFrD1wcEaHr9hrQDDWc\"")
3688  },
3689  }.ToString());
3690  }
3691 
3692  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
3693 
3694  UniValue ret(UniValue::VOBJ);
3695  CTxDestination dest = DecodeDestination(request.params[0].get_str());
3696 
3697  // Make sure the destination is valid
3698  if (!IsValidDestination(dest)) {
3699  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Invalid address");
3700  }
3701 
3702  std::string currentAddress = EncodeDestination(dest);
3703  ret.pushKV("address", currentAddress);
3704 
3705  CScript scriptPubKey = GetScriptForDestination(dest);
3706  ret.pushKV("scriptPubKey", HexStr(scriptPubKey.begin(), scriptPubKey.end()));
3707 
3708  isminetype mine = IsMine(*pwallet, dest);
3709  ret.pushKV("ismine", bool(mine & ISMINE_SPENDABLE));
3710  bool solvable = IsSolvable(*pwallet, scriptPubKey);
3711  ret.pushKV("solvable", solvable);
3712  if (solvable) {
3713  ret.pushKV("desc", InferDescriptor(scriptPubKey, *pwallet)->ToString());
3714  }
3715  ret.pushKV("iswatchonly", bool(mine & ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY));
3716  UniValue detail = DescribeWalletAddress(pwallet, dest);
3717  ret.pushKVs(detail);
3718  if (pwallet->mapAddressBook.count(dest)) {
3719  ret.pushKV("label", pwallet->mapAddressBook[dest].name);
3720  }
3721  ret.pushKV("ischange", pwallet->IsChange(scriptPubKey));
3722  const CKeyMetadata* meta = nullptr;
3723  CKeyID key_id = GetKeyForDestination(*pwallet, dest);
3724  if (!key_id.IsNull()) {
3725  auto it = pwallet->mapKeyMetadata.find(key_id);
3726  if (it != pwallet->mapKeyMetadata.end()) {
3727  meta = &it->second;
3728  }
3729  }
3730  if (!meta) {
3731  auto it = pwallet->m_script_metadata.find(CScriptID(scriptPubKey));
3732  if (it != pwallet->m_script_metadata.end()) {
3733  meta = &it->second;
3734  }
3735  }
3736  if (meta) {
3737  ret.pushKV("timestamp", meta->nCreateTime);
3738  if (meta->has_key_origin) {
3739  ret.pushKV("hdkeypath", WriteHDKeypath(meta->key_origin.path));
3740  ret.pushKV("hdseedid", meta->hd_seed_id.GetHex());
3741  ret.pushKV("hdmasterfingerprint", HexStr(meta->key_origin.fingerprint, meta->key_origin.fingerprint + 4));
3742  }
3743  }
3744 
3745  // Currently only one label can be associated with an address, return an array
3746  // so the API remains stable if we allow multiple labels to be associated with
3747  // an address.
3748  UniValue labels(UniValue::VARR);
3749  std::map<CTxDestination, CAddressBookData>::iterator mi = pwallet->mapAddressBook.find(dest);
3750  if (mi != pwallet->mapAddressBook.end()) {
3751  labels.push_back(AddressBookDataToJSON(mi->second, true));
3752  }
3753  ret.pushKV("labels", std::move(labels));
3754 
3755  return ret;
3756 }

3758 static UniValue getaddressesbylabel(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3759 {

3763  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3764  return NullUniValue;
3765  }

3767  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 1)
3768  throw std::runtime_error(
3769  RPCHelpMan{"getaddressesbylabel",
3770  "\nReturns the list of addresses assigned the specified label.\n",
3771  {
3772  {"label", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The label."},

3790

3796  }
3797  }
3798 
3799  if (ret.empty()) {
3800  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_INVALID_LABEL_NAME, std::string("No addresses with label " + label));
3801  }
3802 
3803  return ret;
3804 }

3863 UniValue sethdseed(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3864 {
3865  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3866  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3867 
3868  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3869  return NullUniValue;
3870  }
3871 
3872  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 2) {
3873  throw std::runtime_error(
3874  RPCHelpMan{"sethdseed",
3875  "\nSet or generate a new HD wallet seed. Non-HD wallets will not be upgraded to being a HD wallet. Wallets that are already\n"
3876  "HD will have a new HD seed set so that new keys added to the keypool will be derived from this new seed.\n"
3877  "\nNote that you will need to MAKE A NEW BACKUP of your wallet after setting the HD wallet seed." +
3878  HelpRequiringPassphrase(pwallet) + "\n",
3879  {
3880  {"newkeypool", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "true", "Whether to flush old unused addresses, including change addresses, from the keypool and regenerate it.\n"
3881  " If true, the next address from getnewaddress and change address from getrawchangeaddress will be from this new seed.\n"
3882  " If false, addresses (including change addresses if the wallet already had HD Chain Split enabled) from the existing\n"
3883  " keypool will be used until it has been depleted."},
3884  {"seed", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "random seed", "The WIF private key to use as the new HD seed.\n"
3885  " The seed value can be retrieved using the dumpwallet command. It is the private key marked hdseed=1"},
3886  },
3887  RPCResults{},
3888  RPCExamples{
3889  HelpExampleCli("sethdseed", "")
3890  + HelpExampleCli("sethdseed", "false")
3891  + HelpExampleCli("sethdseed", "true \"wifkey\"")
3892  + HelpExampleRpc("sethdseed", "true, \"wifkey\"")
3893  },
3894  }.ToString());
3895  }
3896 
3897  if (IsInitialBlockDownload()) {
3898  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_CLIENT_IN_INITIAL_DOWNLOAD, "Cannot set a new HD seed while still in Initial Block Download");
3899  }
3900 
3901  if (pwallet->IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
3902  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Cannot set a HD seed to a wallet with private keys disabled");
3903  }
3904 
3905  auto locked_chain = pwallet->chain().lock();
3906  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
3907 
3908  // Do not do anything to non-HD wallets
3909  if (!pwallet->CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD)) {
3910  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Cannot set a HD seed on a non-HD wallet. Start with -upgradewallet in order to upgrade a non-HD wallet to HD");
3911  }
3912 
3913  EnsureWalletIsUnlocked(pwallet);
3914 
3915  bool flush_key_pool = true;
3916  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
3917  flush_key_pool = request.params[0].get_bool();
3918  }
3919 
3920  CPubKey master_pub_key;
3921  if (request.params[1].isNull()) {
3922  master_pub_key = pwallet->GenerateNewSeed();
3923  } else {
3924  CKey key = DecodeSecret(request.params[1].get_str());
3925  if (!key.IsValid()) {
3926  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Invalid private key");
3927  }
3928 
3929  if (HaveKey(*pwallet, key)) {
3930  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Already have this key (either as an HD seed or as a loose private key)");
3931  }
3932 
3933  master_pub_key = pwallet->DeriveNewSeed(key);
3934  }
3935 
3936  pwallet->SetHDSeed(master_pub_key);
3937  if (flush_key_pool) pwallet->NewKeyPool();
3938 
3939  return NullUniValue;
3940 }

3942 void AddKeypathToMap(const CWallet* pwallet, const CKeyID& keyID, std::map<CPubKey, KeyOriginInfo>& hd_keypaths)
3943 {
3944  CPubKey vchPubKey;
3945  if (!pwallet->GetPubKey(keyID, vchPubKey)) {
3946  return;
3947  }
3948  KeyOriginInfo info;
3949  if (!pwallet->GetKeyOrigin(keyID, info)) {
3950  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INTERNAL_ERROR, "Internal keypath is broken");
3951  }
3952  hd_keypaths.emplace(vchPubKey, std::move(info));
3953 }

3955 UniValue walletprocesspsbt(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3956 {
3957  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3958  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3959 
3960  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3961  return NullUniValue;
3962  }
3963 
3964  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 4)
3965  throw std::runtime_error(
3966  RPCHelpMan{"walletprocesspsbt",
3967  "\nUpdate a PSBT with input information from our wallet and then sign inputs\n"
3968  "that we can sign for." +
3969  HelpRequiringPassphrase(pwallet) + "\n",
3970  {
3971  {"psbt", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The transaction base64 string"},
3972  {"sign", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "true", "Also sign the transaction when updating"},
3973  {"sighashtype", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "ALL", "The signature hash type to sign with if not specified by the PSBT. Must be one of\n"
3974  " \"ALL\"\n"
3975  " \"NONE\"\n"
3976  " \"SINGLE\"\n"
3977  " \"ALL|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
3978  " \"NONE|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
3979  " \"SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY\""},
3980  {"bip32derivs", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "false", "If true, includes the BIP 32 derivation paths for public keys if we know them"},
3981  },
3982  RPCResult{
3983  "{\n"
3984  " \"psbt\" : \"value\", (string) The base64-encoded partially signed transaction\n"
3985  " \"complete\" : true|false, (boolean) If the transaction has a complete set of signatures\n"
3986  " ]\n"
3987  "}\n"
3988  },
3989  RPCExamples{
3990  HelpExampleCli("walletprocesspsbt", "\"psbt\"")
3991  },
3992  }.ToString());
3993 
3994  RPCTypeCheck(request.params, {UniValue::VSTR, UniValue::VBOOL, UniValue::VSTR});
3995 
3996  // Unserialize the transaction
3997  PartiallySignedTransaction psbtx;
3998  std::string error;
3999  if (!DecodeBase64PSBT(psbtx, request.params[0].get_str(), error)) {
4000  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_DESERIALIZATION_ERROR, strprintf("TX decode failed %s", error));
4001  }
4002 
4003  // Get the sighash type
4004  int nHashType = ParseSighashString(request.params[2]);
4005 
4006  // Fill transaction with our data and also sign
4007  bool sign = request.params[1].isNull() ? true : request.params[1].get_bool();
4008  bool bip32derivs = request.params[3].isNull() ? false : request.params[3].get_bool();
4009  bool complete = true;
4010  TransactionError err;
4011  if (!FillPSBT(pwallet, psbtx, err, complete, nHashType, sign, bip32derivs)) {
4012  throw JSONRPCTransactionError(err);
4013  }
4014 
4015  UniValue result(UniValue::VOBJ);
4016  CDataStream ssTx(SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
4017  ssTx << psbtx;
4018  result.pushKV("psbt", EncodeBase64(ssTx.str()));
4019  result.pushKV("complete", complete);
4020 
4021  return result;
4022 }

4104  + HelpExampleCli("walletcreatefundedpsbt", "\"[{\\\"txid\\\":\\\"myid\\\",\\\"vout\\\":0}]\" \"[{\\\"data\\\":\\\"00010203\\\"}]\"")

4108  RPCTypeCheck(request.params, {
4109  UniValue::VARR,
4110  UniValueType(), // ARR or OBJ, checked later
4111  UniValue::VNUM,
4112  UniValue::VOBJ,
4113  UniValue::VBOOL
4114  }, true
4115  );
4116 
4117  CAmount fee;
4118  int change_position;
4119  CMutableTransaction rawTx = ConstructTransaction(request.params[0], request.params[1], request.params[2], request.params[3]["replaceable"]);
4120  FundTransaction(pwallet, rawTx, fee, change_position, request.params[3]);
4121 
4122  // Make a blank psbt
4123  PartiallySignedTransaction psbtx(rawTx);
4124 
4125  // Fill transaction with out data but don't sign
4126  bool bip32derivs = request.params[4].isNull() ? false : request.params[4].get_bool();
4127  bool complete = true;
4128  TransactionError err;
4129  if (!FillPSBT(pwallet, psbtx, err, complete, 1, false, bip32derivs)) {
4130  throw JSONRPCTransactionError(err);
4131  }
4132 
4133  // Serialize the PSBT
4134  CDataStream ssTx(SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
4135  ssTx << psbtx;
4136 
4137  UniValue result(UniValue::VOBJ);
4138  result.pushKV("psbt", EncodeBase64(ssTx.str()));
4139  result.pushKV("fee", ValueFromAmount(fee));
4140  result.pushKV("changepos", change_position);
4141  return result;
4142 }
